public interface Operator extends Serializable
An operator is any node that within a WayangPlan.

An operator is basically determined by

  • its type,
  • its configuration,
  • its InputSlots, and
  • its OutputSlots.
The former two aspects are handled by subclassed, the latter two are basic features of every operator.

Slots are typed input and output declarations of each operator and can be connected to each other to form a full WayangPlan. Moreover, we distinguish between two kinds of InputSlots:

  1. Regular.Each operator will have set up these InputSlots already during its creation. They are indexed from 0 to the number of InputSlots - 1.
  2. Broadcast.Some operators permit for broadcast InputSlots. These are dynamically added and will be indexed after the regular ones. Also, their execution semantics differ: Broadcast input data will be provided before the regular data.

  • Field Summary

    Fields
    Modifier and Type
    Field
    Description
    static final int
    FIRST_EPOCH
    Each operator is associated with an epoch, which is a logical timestamp for the operator's creation.

  • Field Details

    • FIRST_EPOCH

      static final int FIRST_EPOCH
      Each operator is associated with an epoch, which is a logical timestamp for the operator's creation. This value is the lowest timestamp and default epoch.
      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

    • setInput

      default void setInput(int index, InputSlot<?> input)
      Sets the InputSlot of this instance. This method must only be invoked, when the input index is not yet filled.
      Parameters:
      index - at which the InputSlot should be placed
      input - the new InputSlot

    • setOutput

      Sets the OutputSlot of this instance. This method must only be invoked, when the output index is not yet filled.
      Parameters:
      index - at which the OutputSlot should be placed
      output - the new OutputSlot

      default void broadcastTo(int thisOutputIndex, Operator that, String broadcastName)
      Connect an output of this operator as a broadcast input of a second operator.
      Parameters:
      thisOutputIndex - index of the output slot to connect to
      that - operator to connect to
      broadcastName - name of the broadcast that will be used by the operator to identify the broadcast; must be unique among all InputSlots

    • isOwnerOf

      default boolean isOwnerOf(Slot<?> slot)

    • getForwards

      default Collection<OutputSlot<?>> getForwards(InputSlot<?> input)
      Declare forward rules. Execution engines may take the chance to optimize the executed plans by having forwarded data by-pass this instance. However, note the specific semantics of a forward rule: If an Operator serves an OutputSlot that is involved in a foward rule, it will do so by forwarding. If the OutputSlot is not served, then the forwarding does not apply.
      Returns:
      OutputSlots to which this instance forwards the given input.
      See Also:
      • isReading(InputSlot)

    • isUnconnected

      default boolean isUnconnected()
      Checks whether this instance is not connected to any other instance via its Slots. This is a typical property of instances used for ChannelConversions.
      Returns:
      whether this instance is unconnected

    • isReading

      default boolean isReading(InputSlot<?> input)
      Tells whether the given input is read by this operator. If not, the optimizer can make use of this insight.
      See Also:
      • getForwards(InputSlot)

    • isFeedbackInput

      default boolean isFeedbackInput(InputSlot<?> input)
      Returns:
      whether this input is used to close a feedback loop (i.e., a flow graph cycle)

    • isFeedforwardOutput

      default boolean isFeedforwardOutput(OutputSlot<?> ouput)
      Returns:
      whether this output is used to start a feedback loop (i.e., a flow graph cycle)

    • isSink

      default boolean isSink()
      Tells whether this operator is a sink, i.e., it has no outputs.
      Returns:
      whether this operator is a sink

    • isSource

      default boolean isSource()
      Tells whether this operator is a source, i.e., it has no inputs.
      Returns:
      whether this operator is a source

      default boolean isLoopHead()
      Identify this instance as the head of a loop. It is the only kind of Operator that can cause data flow cycles.
      Returns:
      whether this instance is the head of a loop

    • getParent

      default CompositeOperator getParent()
      Operators can be nested in other operators, e.g., in a Subplan or a OperatorAlternative.
      Returns:
      the parent of this operator or null if this is a top-level operator

    • addTargetPlatform

      void addTargetPlatform(Platform platform)
      Optional operation. Restrict this instance to be executed/implemented on a certain Platforms or allow a further one if there is already a restriction in place.

    • propagateOutputCardinality

      default void propagateOutputCardinality(int outputIndex, OptimizationContext.OperatorContext operatorContext)
      Convenience version of propagateOutputCardinality(int, OptimizationContext.OperatorContext), where the adjacent InputSlots reside in the same OptimizationContext as the operatorContext.

    • propagateOutputCardinality

      void propagateOutputCardinality(int outputIndex, OptimizationContext.OperatorContext operatorContext, OptimizationContext targetContext)
      Propagates the CardinalityEstimate of an OutputSlot within the operatorContext to
      • fed InputSlots (which in turn are asked to propagate) and
      • inner, mapped OutputSlots.
      Parameters:
      outputIndex - of the OutputSlot
      operatorContext - holds the CardinalityEstimate to be propagated
      targetContext - to which the CardinalityEstimates should be propagated

    • propagateInputCardinality

      void propagateInputCardinality(int inputIndex, OptimizationContext.OperatorContext operatorContext)
      Propagates the CardinalityEstimate of an InputSlot within the operatorContext to inner, mapped InputSlots.
      Parameters:
      inputIndex - of the InputSlot
      operatorContext - holds the CardinalityEstimate to be propagated

    • collectMappedOutputSlots

      <T> Set<OutputSlot<T>> collectMappedOutputSlots(OutputSlot<T> output)
      Collect all inner OutputSlots that are mapped to the given OutputSlot.

    • collectMappedInputSlots

      <T> Set<InputSlot<T>> collectMappedInputSlots(InputSlot<T> input)
      Collect all inner InputSlots that are mapped to the given InputSlot.
